title: Analysis
content:
View license compliance information

On the Analysis page, click the Compliance analysis card to view the licensing and consumption information of each product.

License tab

  1. In the left panel, select a product.

    The License tab provides a summary of license details and related licenses of the selected product.

    Section Field Description
    Summary Product version The version of the product.
    Product version.Commercial model Specifies whether the product version is commercial, freeware, or has an unknown license type.
    License metric The license metric of the product.
    Organization compliance scope Specifies the organizational scopes used to calculate compliance results and generate reports.
    Purchased entitlements The points for purchasing full licenses directly.
    Purchased upgrade entitlements

    The points that are purchased to access a newer license version on the basis of your base licenses.

    Some vendors provide upgrade license SKUs to save costs by upgrading licenses from existing older versions to target versions, which is more cost-efficient than purchasing the full license of the target version directly.
    Entitlements from lower versions The increase in the number of license points when a software license is upgraded from a lower version to the current version.
    Entitlements consumed by higher versions The decrease in the number of license points when a software license is upgraded to a higher version from the current version.
    Total entitlements The number of effective licenses available in the license pool, which is calculated based on the purchased points (full license)​, purchased points (upgrade license)​, and points upgraded from lower versions.
    Consumed entitlements The number of license points consumed by software installations.
    Balance​ The gap between effective points and consumed points.
    Related licenses Id The identifier of the related license.
    Display label External (common) name of the software.
    License model.License metric The license metric of the license.
    Total entitlements

    Total number of rights to use your software derives from the license agreement.
    Quantity The number of related licenses.
    Support upgrades when available The license will be auto-upgraded to a new version available during the effective service period of the maintenance contract
    Default maintenance contract The name of the default maintenance contract for the license.
    Default maintenance contract.Effective from The date when the default maintenance contract of the license comes into effect.
    Default maintenance contract.Expires on The date when the default maintenance contract of the license expires.
  2. In the Summary section, select a record and click the Details to view its Details and Related licenses on the General tab page.

  3. Click the link of the Id column in the Related licenses table to view the license record information. For details of each tab of the license record details page, see Edit a license record.

Consumption tab (on-premises products only)

This tab is available only for on-premises products that use license rule-based compliance calculation.

For device-based licensing and user-based licensing, the license consumption information provided is different.

Device-based licensing

  1. In the left panel, select a product.
    All related devices appear in the Devices section on the right. If you have enabled the Support cluster scenarios option for the product in Products, the Clusters section appears listing all related clusters, the cluster type, and the number of configuration items in each cluster.
  2. In the Devices section, click a device to view its basic information, product deployment information, and license consumption information on the following tab pages.
    Tab Description
    General Describes the basic hardware information of the selected device.
    Deployment

    Lists the physical or virtual machines that have the product installed.

    The deployment information is a snapshot based on the last license compliance calculation. It doesn't reflect real-time information on installed software applications in UD/UCMDB.
    Consumption

    Lists the license consumption details of the selected device.  

    • Details: Shows the license rules assigned to the product and the consumption result for each rule.  One license rule can have many consumption results depending on how many algorithms the rule has. The highlighted check mark ( ) indicates the consumption result aggregated for product compliance calculation.
      From the table, you can see the number of licenses consumed by each product version. Click View in the Consumption details column to learn the license consumption details of each product version on each machine. The Description field provides a short description of compliance calculation.

    • Allocated Licenses: Lists the licenses assigned to the device.

      If the section is empty, it means that the license pool doesn't have enough points to assign to the device. You need to procure more points to be compliant.

      Currently, SAM allocates licenses in a random way and you can't update or define the relationship. For more information about the license reservation mechanism, see Calculate license consumption.
  3. In the Clusters section, click a cluster name to view its basic information, product deployment information, and license consumption information on the following tab pages.
    Tab Description
    General Shows the name and type of the cluster.
    Deployment

    Lists all the devices including virtual machines in the cluster, the device type, the operating system of the device, the product version installed on the device, and the directory where the product is installed.
    Consumption Lists the devices in the cluster and the licenses consumed on each device.
Manage device

If you have integrated Service Management with UD/UCMDB and have enabled the new SAM solution, SAM provides a link for you to manage a device in Service Management. To do this:

  1. Make sure you have synchronized device data from UCMDB.
  2. Go to the device details page, click Manage device in the upper-left corner or the device name on the Deployment page to view and manage the device in Service Management.
    If you haven't integrated Service Management with UD/UCMDB, you might see an error message, indicating that no device data is available.

User-based licensing

  1. In the left panel, select a product.
    The product entitlement information and user list appear on the right.
    Section Field Description
    Entitlement Product version The version of the product.
    License metric The license metric of the product.
    Entitlement The total number of licenses purchased.
    Entitled points The total number of licenses entitled to the users.
    Users User

    The user who's either entitled to use the product or has installed the product.

    If the device owner information isn't available, the user name might be <N/A>. You can go to Service Asset & Configuration to add the device owner information. For more information, see Edit a device record.
    Installations

    The number of products that the user has installed. 

    If the user name is <N/A>, the value of this field is the total number of devices that don't have device owner information. For more information about how to assign an owner to a device, see Edit a device record.
    Entitled points The number of licenses that the user is entitled to use.
  2. To filter data by entitlement and installation categories, click Category.
    • All: shows all the users who are either entitled to use the product or has installed the product on their devices. 
    • Entitled and installed: shows a list of users who are entitled to use the product and have installed the product on their devices.
    • Unentitled but installed: shows a list of users who aren't authorized to use the product but have the product installed on their devices.
    • Entitled but not installed: shows a list of users who are entitled to use the product but haven't installed the product on their devices.
  3. Click a user name to view the basic information, deployment information, and license consumption information on the following tab pages. 
    Tab Description
    General Describes the basic user information, including the display name and the principal name.
    Deployment

    Lists the user's software installations and the detailed device information, such as the operating system and installed product version.

    The deployment information is a snapshot based on the last license compliance calculation. It doesn't reflect real-time information on installed software applications in UD/UCMDB.
    Consumption Lists the licenses consumed by the user based on the default license rule on the License rule settings tab page. 
    • Details: Shows the license rule assigned to the product and the consumption result. The highlighted check mark ( ) indicates the consumption result aggregated for product compliance calculation.
      From the table, you can see the number of licenses consumed by each product version. The Description field provides a short description of compliance calculation.
    • Entitlement: Shows the license entitlement information of the product versions. 

User entitlement tab (SaaS products only)

The user entitlement tab lists the SaaS product users and the services that each user is entitled to. The tab is available when you select a SaaS product (such as Microsoft 365). The user entitlement information is imported through the Integration with SaaS products.

Description of the columns:

  • Product version: The service included in the SaaS product.
  • Username: The user's display name.
  • User principal name: A unique identifier (typically the user's email) of the user.
  • Person status: The status of the user in Service Management. This column has a value only if the user is a Service Management user.
  • Last login date: The most recent date when the user logs in to the SaaS product. This value might not be available for certain SaaS products.

Optimization tab (SaaS products only)

The Optimization tab identifies the possible cost-saving optimizations that you can make.

Reclamation candidates section

This section lists the SaaS users who are not active according to different criteria (see below). These users are good candidates when you consider reclaiming under-utilized subscriptions.

The following columns indicate why the system deems the user inactive:

  • Not logged in SaaS Within X days: The user hasn't logged in to the SaaS product for the period of time as defined by the Identify inactive licenses by user's last login setting (on the Product details form). 
  • Unrecognized: The user isn't a Service Management user.
  • Inactive: The user is a Service Management user, but has a status other than Active.

View EOS products

With SAM, you can view the End of Support installed software data for common software vendor products that can be discovered by Universal Discovery. This feature requires installing the eos.zip package in the latest version of Inventory Discovery Knowledge Pack for UCMDB and running the Inventory Discovery by Scanner job. 

To view and analyze EOS products:

  1. Go to the Products page, click Sync from UD/UCMDB, and then wait until the synchronization job finishes.
    If you have configured a scheduler for synchronizing product data from UD/UCMDB, you can also wait until the scheduled task completes. For more information about schedulers, see Define a scheduler.
  2. Go to the Analysis page.
    The number on the EOS card is the total number of product versions that will reach the end of their lifecycle within one year.​
  3. Click the EOS card.
    This action opens a page with four cards showing the number of products that will reach the EOS date within one month, three months, six months, and 12 months.
  4. Click a card to view the details of product versions that will end of support within the selected date range, including the specific EOS date and the number of product instances installed in your environment.
    • To change the EOS date, select the desired date range from the EOS date drop-down list box. You can also choose a specific date range.
    • To search for a vendor or product version, enter the keyword in the search box in the upper-right corner above the product table.
  5. Click the link in the Number of instances column to view the devices that have the EOS product version installed.
  6. Click a device name to view and manage the device.
    The link works only when you have integrated Service Management with UD/UCMDB and have synchronized device data from UCMDB. Or, you might see an error message, indicating that no device data is available.
